title: The Thing

title: The Thing
top_review_text:
100% pure horror.
100% complete paranoia.
100% practical effects.
100% proof that horror doesn't need CGI.
100% inimitable.
100% Carpenter
100% timeless. (it's 38 years old!!)
100% terrifying. Still.
100% visual masterpiece.
100% mold breaking.
1000% One of my favourite horror films ever made.

p.s. Math was never my strong point.

top_review_text: The rain patters deliberately. It's trying. It's trying real hard to cool off the world, but to no avail. The greatest cinematographic achievement of all time.

title: Civil War
top_review_text:
i feel like all of Alex Garland's films could be called Annihilation.
he comes threateningly close to saying something ‚Äî anything ‚Äî about the various ways that Americans process and/or distance ourselves from the violent realities that seem "foreign" to us, but it never really gets there. appreciated its audacity to a point (and appreciated its cast throughout), but such a stick-in-the-eye provocation needs to be a hell of a lot sharper in order to make people look at things differently.
